title: xss in DM group name in twitter

activities.message:
Also, When you navigate to New messages from DM Dialog/box itself, you get a recent conversations, there also if you select this DM group, You will see a XSS popup!

Impact of this could be even higher as anybody can change the group name at anytime in the conversation. So if someone decides to write some DM to someone and goes to write new message option, he can see recent conversation and one of group name there being some xss payload(specially non tech people), they will click it to see what the group name is about and it will popup a xss for them
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message: Thanks again. As mentioned we’ll keep you updated as we investigate further. As a reminder, please remember to keep the details of this report private until we have fully investigated and addressed the issue.

activities.message: 280$ for stored xss on main twitter domain? May I know the reason please for such a low bounty ? As per program terms it should get 2500$
activities.markdown_message: 280$ for stored xss on main twitter domain? May I know the reason please for such a low bounty ? As per program terms it should get 2500$

activities.message:
The $2520 amount excludes self-xss and XSS blocked by CSP. We believe the attack scenario to be sufficiently complicated that this is essentially self-xss. If you believe we've missed anything please let us know.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!
activities.markdown_message:
The $2520 amount excludes self-xss and XSS blocked by CSP. We believe the attack scenario to be sufficiently complicated that this is essentially self-xss. If you believe we've missed anything please let us know.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!

activities.message:
This is not self xss.user in group conversation are affected by this. Also it is triggered in 2 situations.

1.when victim visit the new conversation, there you get recent conversation. If that group appears there and if they click it,it will popup xss for them

2.anyone in that group conversation, if shares a tweet via DM option to that group will get XSS popup 


This works in almost all recent browsers too
activities.markdown_message:
This is not self xss.user in group conversation are affected by this. Also it is triggered in 2 situations.

1.when victim visit the new conversation, there you get recent conversation. If that group appears there and if they click it,it will popup xss for them

2.anyone in that group conversation, if shares a tweet via DM option to that group will get XSS popup

This works in almost all recent browsers too

activities.message: Also as I mentioned, group name can be changed anytime by any user in the conversation. So it is not necessarily xss payload name initially. Attacker can change the group name at any time later to xss payload when sufficient people starts conversation and joins the group
activities.markdown_message: Also as I mentioned, group name can be changed anytime by any user in the conversation. So it is not necessarily xss payload name initially. Attacker can change the group name at any time later to xss payload when sufficient people starts conversation and joins the group

activities.message:
Thanks for the additional information regarding impact. We will increase the bounty amount shortly to account for this report describing how this vulnerability might be used to exploit another user.

Thanks again for thinking of Twitter security!

activities.message:
Thanks for additional bounty but i still feel its a less considering its an xss in main twitter domain. This report was very similar to #119022 and it got $2520 and also it was on twitter subdomain.

 i understand that this bug require some user interaction but still $700 is not justifiable amount considering the impact and specially an xss which is on main twitter domain and can affect many other users (if multiple groups created)


for eg  if there are groups which are already created which has more than 100 people per group, anyone in the conversation can change the group name to xss payload and when victim shares the tweet via DM, xss wil get executed!

Steps would have been

1. suppose there was group named `TESTGROUP`  which had 150 people in conversation
2. someone from group conversation changes the name of the group to `<script>alert(1);//`
3. victim/other people in the conversation , clicks New Message--> Recent--> vulnerable group, xss would execute

or

3. People in conversation , shares a tweet via DM option, they will get XSS popup!

Regards
Ashish
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for additional bounty but i still feel its a less considering its an xss in main twitter domain. This report was very similar to #119022 and it got $2520 and also it was on twitter subdomain.

i understand that this bug require some user interaction but still $700 is not justifiable amount considering the impact and specially an xss which is on main twitter domain and can affect many other users (if multiple groups created)

for eg if there are groups which are already created which has more than 100 people per group, anyone in the conversation can change the group name to xss payload and when victim shares the tweet via DM, xss wil get executed!

Steps would have been

  1. suppose there was group named TESTGROUP which had 150 people in conversation
  2. someone from group conversation changes the name of the group to <script>alert(1);//
  3. victim/other people in the conversation , clicks New Message--> Recent--> vulnerable group, xss would execute

or

  1. People in conversation , shares a tweet via DM option, they will get XSS popup!

Regards
Ashish

vulnerability_information_html:
hi,

found a xss on twitter

Steps

  1. Create a DM group with payload <script>alert(1);//

  2. Whenever anybody shares a tweet via DM, XSS will popup

POC https://youtu.be/P2Ram2FBAS4
